WebGL EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch Extension Proposed Specification

DO NOT IMPLEMENT!!!

Name

EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch

Contact

WebGL working group (public_webgl 'at' khronos.org)

Contributors

Ray Tran, Snap Inc

Version

Last modified date: August 28, 2020
Revision: 2

Number

WebGL extension #XYZ

Dependencies

Written against the WebGL API 1.0 specification.

The OpenGL ES Shading Language version affects the definition of this extension.

Overview

This extension exposes the EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch functionality to WebGL.

There are no WebGL-specific behavioral changes.

Consult the above extension for documentation, issues and new functions and enumerants.

When this extension is enabled:

  • It provides a mechanism whereby a fragment shader may read existing framebuffer data as input.
  • Using The OpenGL ES Shading Language Version 1.00, prior to fragment shading, if GL_EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch is enabled, gl_LastFragData[] is populated with the value last written to the framebuffer at the same (x,y,sample) position.
  • Using The OpenGL ES Shading Language Version 3.00, prior to fragment shading, if GL_EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch is enabled, use of inout instead of out when declaring a fragment output will enable the fragment output to be populated with the value last written to the framebuffer at the same (x,y,sample) position.
  • If EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch_non_coherent is supported, a call to FramebufferFetchBarrierEXT(void) can be made to ensure the populated values are fragment data drawn before the barrier.

IDL

    [LegacyNoInterfaceObject]
    interface EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch {
    };

    [LegacyNoInterfaceObject]
    interface EXT_shader_framebuffer_fetch_non_coherent {
      void FramebufferFetchBarrierEXT(void);
    };

Sample Code

    //The OpenGL ES Shading Language, Version 1.00
    void main(){
        float lum = dot(gl_LastFragData[0].rgb, vec3(0.2125, 0.7154, 0.0721));
        gl_FragColor = vec4(vec3(lum), gl_LastFragData[0].a);
    }
    
    // The OpenGL ES Shading Language, Version 3.00
    layout (location = 0) inout vec4 colourAttachment0;
    void main(){
        float lum = dot(colourAttachment0.rgb, vec3(0.2125, 0.7154, 0.0721));
        colourAttachment0.rgb = vec3(lum);
    }
